thread.title: William and Kate mark World Mental Health Day
thread.title_full: William and Kate mark World Mental Health Day

title: William and Kate mark World Mental Health Day
text:
Prince William and Duchess Kate are putting their royal patronage behind mental health charities. (Photo: Arthur Edwards, AP)
25 CONNECT 35 TWEET 5 LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Prince William and Duchess Kate spent Saturday promoting a cause that needs all the positive attention it can get: Mental health.
On Saturday, the royal couple participated in World Mental Health Day at London's Harrow College, meeting with volunteers from the organization Mind, who are working on an anti-stigma campaign Time to Change, reports Britain's Daily Mail .
Paul Farmer, Mind's chief executive officer showed his appreciation for their patronage: "By putting a spotlight on mental health, the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge are helping us to send an important and urgent message to the world that it is time to change our attitudes about mental health problems ... For too long mental health has been something that families did not speak about, that schools did not know how to address and workplaces would ignore. This silence or ignorance leaves people living with mental health problems alone, afraid and without the help and support that they need. We cannot let this continue."
Later in the day, they split up to a pair of other events. William attended anti-bullying workshop sponsored by his late mother, Princess Diana, while Kate, sporting a black-and-white Tory Burch dress, visited the Anna Freud Center, which specializes in helping children and young people with mental health issues.
William and Kate participated in a roundtable discussion with volunteers from the charity Mind about ways to remove the stigma attached to mental health issues. (Photo: Arthur Edwards, AP)
